item.description:
Hey everyone, I'm trying to get a last couple of hikes in before winter...join us for Mount Eisenhower! (Note: Please only sign up if you are sure you can go....we have had problems lately with people dropping out at the last minute after taking up a spot that someone else would have used. Thanks!)

Mount Eisenhower is one of New Hampshire's 4000-footers and has only Mt Monroe between it and Mt Washington in the Presidential range. It is the 12th highest of the NH 4000-footers at 4760 feet. It has a bald summit with 360 degree views of the southern Presidentials including Mt Washington. This hike will follow the Edmand's Path for most of the hike with small stretches on the Mt Eisenhower Loop trail and the Crawford Path (then return by Edmand's Path). Most of the path is a very gradual climb but be aware that the final section (.2 miles) of the Edmand's path and above are completely exposed to the elements.

We will meet at the Edmand's Path trial head on Mt Clinton rd. Parking is $3.

Poor weather WILL cancel this hike....a determination will be made on Friday.

Please note that dogs are not permitted on this hike.

Details

What: Mount Eishenhower
Distance: 7.1 miles
Elevation Gain: 2750'
Difficulty: Moderate
Pace: Moderate/Slow. Approximately 1 to 1.5 miles per hour.
Exposure: Fully exposed for the final .6 miles approaching the summit.
Estimated Time: 6 hours including breaks.

Is This Hike for Me?

This hike will be at a slow/moderate pace. We will make every attempt to keep the group together throughout the hike. The trail is never very steep and has good footing but is fully exposed approaching the summit.

To participate you should:


  • Be comfortable hiking UPHILL at about 1.5 to 2.0 miles per hour at a 15% incline for about 4 miles.
  • Be comfortable walking at least 8 miles on uneven terrain including roots, rocks, and granite ledges.
  • Have sturdy hiking boots. No Sneakers!
  • Have rain and wind protection. No Ponchos!
  • Be able to carry at least 2-3 liters of water. (3 strongly recommended.) (Remember, 1 liter weighs 2 pounds!)
  • Be in good physical condition.


Equipment List


  • Synthetic shirt and pants. No cotton. No jeans.
  • Sturdy Hiking Boots. No Sneakers.
  • Rain / Wind Jacket. No Ponchos.
  • Multiple warm layers as temperatures will be much colder this late into October
  • 2-3 liters Water
  • Headlamp
  • Trail Snacks
  • Lunch
  • Microspikes or Stabilizers in case we hit some ice




Optional Gear:


  • Hiking Poles
  • Gaiters
  • Sunscreen / Sunglasses
  • Camera / Binoculars

    No Jeans, Sneakers, or Cotton clothing on the hike!


    Trail Head Directions
    Mt Clinton rd can be found off of rt302 right near the AMC Highland Center. The trail head is on the right 2.3 miles in.


    Contact Information

    My cell: 508-414-8544. I probably will not have service at the trail head so please call early if you need to get in touch with me.

    Liability Waiver

    As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Yellow Ford Escape with RI plates
item.name: Mount Eisenhower
